name: S.A.L.F.s
description:
Game created in 72h for the Ludum Dare 47 Game Jam. If you want to rate it as part of the Jam, here is the link: https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/47/s-a-l-f

IMPORTANT

- It is highly recommended to use a downloadable version of the game for full performance. The game can be a bit laggy in the browser.

- Play in full screen for a better experience.

DESCRIPTION

You play as Dr. Julia Rey, a scientist studying the mysterious SALFs (Strange Automated Life Forms). This game is mostly about observing and asking yourself questions.

It is my first attempt to create a complete story-driven game. I also absolutely wanted to create a procedural creature generator so here is the result! Actually writing the story takes so much more time than expected!

KNOWN ISSUES

  • If you get through the text to fast, the game may crash (wait at least that one creature is generated before continuing)
  • Some typos, spelling and grammar errors (English is not my native tongue)
  • The UI is not as much responsive as I wanted, so you may have some issues on small screens.
  • Sometimes, some SALFs appear from nowhere.

TOOLS USED

  • Engine: Godot Engine
  • Draw: Inkscape & Krita
  • Music: Orca & Pilot
  • Sounds: rFXGen
